data.title: The Best Tennis Players from Australia
data.meta_description: Over 2K sports fans have voted on the 50+ athletes on Best Tennis Players from Australia. Current Top 3: Rod Laver, Margaret Court, Ken Rosewall
data.text:
Ranked By

8.1K votes

2.3K voters

Serving up a list of the best tennis players from Australia, listed by popularity with photos of the players when available. Australia has produced some exceptionally talented tennis players over the years, including both men and women. These are some of the most talented Australian tennis players to ever live, so if you're a native of Australia and are aspire to play tennis professionally, then these Aussies are your idols. If you're searching for a particular popular tennis player from Australia or just have an interest in Aussie tennis players, this is the place to be.

This list is made up of many different players, including Mervyn Rose and Nell Hall Hopman. This list answers the questions, "Who are the greatest Australian tennis players?" and "Who is the best Australian tennis player of all time?"

You can click on the names of these legendary tennis players of Australia in order to get more information about each one. If you play tennis or just love the sport then use this list of talented Australian tennis players to find some athletes from down under you haven't heard of before.

Most divisive: Mark Philippoussis

Over 2.3K Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Tennis Players from Australia

1

596 VOTES

Rod Laver, a true legend in the history of tennis, is renowned as one of the greatest Australian players to have graced the sport; his phenomenal performances across all surfaces make him stand out among his contemporaries. Known for his fluid groundstrokes, impeccable net play, and a distinctive left-handed topspin serve, Laver's unique playing style enthralled crowds and defined an era of Australian tennis dominance. His impact on the sport transcends his on-court accomplishments and continues to inspire generations of tennis players worldwide.

2

298 VOTES

Margaret Court, often hailed as the queen of Australian tennis, has left an indelible mark on the sport with her remarkable achievements and exceptional skill. Blessed with extraordinary athleticism, Court's aggressive serve-and-volley style of play was a sight to behold and revolutionized women's tennis. As a trailblazer for female athletes, her influence goes beyond the court, and she remains an enduring symbol of excellence in the world of tennis.

3

287 VOTES

Ken Rosewall, affectionately known as "Muscles," is a true Australian tennis icon, who captivated fans with his artistry on the court and innate ability to produce magical moments. Rosewall's backhand slice was the stuff of legends, and his tactical mastery made him a formidable opponent in all conditions. His unwavering dedication and passion for the sport have left a lasting legacy, inspiring generations of Australian tennis enthusiasts.

4

234 VOTES

John Newcombe, a titan of the tennis world, holds a special place in the pantheon of Australian greats, thanks to his lethal serve-and-volley game and indomitable spirit. Newcombe's powerful serve and deft touch at the net made him a force to be reckoned with on grass courts. His fierce competitive instincts and unrelenting drive for success have left an indelible impact on the sport and continue to inspire generations of athletes.

5

164 VOTES

Lew Hoad, a prodigious talent in the annals of Australian tennis, dazzled audiences with his incredible strength and natural ability to generate pace. Hoad's thunderous serve and ferocious groundstrokes struck fear into the hearts of his opponents, making him a dominant force in the golden age of Australian tennis. His awe-inspiring performances and raw power on the court have left a shining legacy for future generations of players to admire.

6

311 VOTES

Patrick Rafter, an emblem of tenacity and grit, remains one of Australia's most beloved tennis champions, with his relentless work ethic and never-say-die attitude. Rafter's athletic prowess at the net combined with his heavy-kicking serve made him a formidable presence on the court. His fighting spirit and passionate on-court demeanor have left a lasting impression on the Australian tennis landscape, proving the power of perseverance and determination.
